intro: Hololachna songarica, commonly known as the Songarica hololachna, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in umbels, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in its native range.
